title: Why Dan Orlovsky believes Drake Maye is NFL MVP frontrunner
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Drake Maye has led the Patriots to a 6-2 record, completing 75.2% of his passes for 2,026 yards and 15 touchdowns.
Dan Orlovsky claims Drake Maye is the NFL MVP frontrunner, emphasizing his high performance despite limited player support around him.
Maye ranks third in NFL MVP odds, behind Patrick Mahomes and Josh Allen, according to DraftKings.

title: Brookline farm starts free farmers market as Mass. residents brace for SNAP shutdown
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Allandale Farm partners with Loring Greenough House for a free market offering produce as SNAP benefits face threats from shutdown.
The market operates on the first three Thursdays in November in Jamaica Plain, with bread donations from Iggy's Bread, Cambridge.
Gov. Maura Healey announces increased aid for food banks and a SNAP support hub to offset federal assistance loss.

title: $9,000 in donations stolen from Catholic church in Watertown, police say
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: $9,000 in donations were stolen from St. Patrick's Church in Watertown on October 27 after 5:30 p.m.
The theft was discovered the next morning and reported to Watertown police at about 8:30 a.m.
No suspects have been identified; police urge the public to provide information or video to Detective Joe Kelland.

title: Bruinsâ€™ Elias Lindholm exits game with lower-body injury
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Elias Lindholm exited the Bruins' overtime win against the Sabres with a lower-body injury after colliding with Jordan Greenway.
Bruins coach Marco Sturm reported no official update on Lindholm but indicated concern given Lindholm's need for assistance off the ice.
Boston may adjust its lineup, potentially promoting Pavel Zacha as Lindholm's replacement on the top line next to David Pastrnak.

title: David Ortiz offers up advice to Mookie Betts amid World Series slump
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: David Ortiz advised Mookie Betts to focus on having fun amid his World Series slump against the Toronto Blue Jays.
Mookie Betts is batting .130 with no extra-base hits in the World Series, as the Dodgers face a 3-2 series deficit.
Top Dodgers hitters, including Betts, struggled in Game 5, collectively going 1-for-15 in the loss to the Blue Jays.

title: Irish firefighter found guilty of raping woman in Boston hotel, sentenced to 7-9 years in prison
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Terence Crosbie, an Irish firefighter, was sentenced to 7-9 years in prison for raping a woman in a Boston hotel.
Crosbie was found guilty in his retrial after a previous mistrial and has already served 20 months in jail.
The victim stated that Crosbie showed no remorse, and he plans to appeal the verdict, maintaining his innocence.

title: Brockton man allegedly in US illegally sentenced to prison for raping 14-year-old girl
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Erickson Barbosa, 32, from Cape Verde, was sentenced to seven years for raping a 14-year-old girl in 2020.
Barbosa must serve five years probation after prison; the incidents occurred in Taunton, Massachusetts in April 2020.
Barbosa, in the U.S. illegally, fled to Florida in 2024 but was captured and may face deportation.

title: ‘Special stuff’: Why Patriots CB Marcus Jones’s October was one to remember
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Marcus Jones received the AFC Defensive Player of the Month award and signed a three-year extension with the Patriots.
Jones excelled in October, notably intercepting Josh Allen and achieving an 87-yard punt return touchdown against the Panthers.
Jones leads Patriots defensive backs in tackles and ranks third in NFL punt return yards despite fewer attempts.

title: Dartmouth man pleads guilty to 2024 murder of New Bedford woman
author: Sana Muneer
bullets: Tyler Baglini, 32, of Dartmouth, pleaded guilty to murdering Kerri Fidalgo, 31, in Fall River Superior Court.
Baglini received a life sentence with the possibility of parole after 25 years for the 2024 murder.
Fidalgo was found with multiple stab wounds at 86 Atlantic St., New Bedford, on September 20, 2024.

title: Boston police says they seized 9 more scooters as crackdown continues
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Boston Police seized nine mopeds and issued seven summonses during 'Operation Safe Scooter' on Tuesday night.
Operation Safe Scooter targets safety concerns related to unregistered scooters, underage riders, and links to violent crimes.
More than 50 scooters have been seized by Boston Police since October as part of the operation's ongoing efforts.
